IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: IT IS THE MISSION OF NEW HORIZONS REHABILITATION SERVICES, INC. TO MAXIMIZE EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND ASSIST THOSE WITH BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: INVESTING IN OUR COMMUNITIES BY PROVIDING EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR INDIVUALS FACING BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT.
IRS990.Desc: ORGANIZATIONAL EMPLOYMENT - INCLUDES TRAINING FOR INDEPENDENCE AND SELF HELP. PREPARING INDIVIDUALS FOR WORK OPPORTUNITIES, VOLUNTEER, AND COMMUNITY INCLUSION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: COMMUNITY PROGRAM AND JOB COACHING - COMMUNITY PROGRAM INCLUDES YOUTH BASED LEARNING AND JOB SUPPORT PROGRAMS SUCH AS SCHOOL TO WORK TRANSITION AND PRE-EMPLOYMENT TRANSITION SERVICES WHERE THERE IS A JOB READINESS AND ON THE JOB TRAINING CORRELATION OF THE INDIVIDUALS SERVED. ADDITIONALLY, WE OFFER CUSTOMIZED JOB EXPLORATION TO MATCH THE SKILL AND READINESS OF THE INDIVIDUAL SERVED. WE ASSISTED 133 INDIVIDUALS WITH OBTAINING EMPLOYMENT WITH AVERAGE WAGES OF $13.12.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: VOCATIONAL EVALUATION AND WORK ADJUSTMENT - WE EVALUATE AND ASSESS ONE'S SKILLS, STRENGTHS, AND BARRIERS AT COMMUNITY EMPLOYMENT SITES TO THEN FORMULATE A VOCATIONAL PLAN TO ACHIEVE SUCCESSFUL EMPLOYMENT OUTCOMES. WE UTILIZE JOB SHADOWS AND INFORMATIONAL INTERVIEWS WHEN WXPLORING JOB INTEREST AND OPPORTUNITIES.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART III, LINE 12, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: MISCELLANEOUS REVENUE - 2018 AMOUNT: $ 2,275. 2019 AMOUNT: $ 59,623. 2020 AMOUNT: $ 110,845. 2021 AMOUNT: $ 6,089. 2022 AMOUNT: $ 14,551.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS RECEIVED NOTIFICATION THAT IT QUALIFIES AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE U.S. INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND CORRESPONDING PROVISIONS OF STATE LAW AND, ACCORDINGLY, IS NOT SUBJECT TO FEDERAL OR STATE INCOME TAXES ON RELATED INCOME. THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS GUIDELINES INCLUDED IN STANDARDS RELATING TO THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES. THE TAX EFFECTS FROM AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION CAN BE RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, ONLY IF THE POSITION IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT TO BE SUSTAINED ON AUDIT, BASED ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION. BASED ON ITS EVALUATION, THE ORGANIZATION HAS CONCLUDED THAT THERE ARE NO SIGNIFICANT UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS REQUIRING RECOGNITION IN ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT CURRENTLY UNDER EXAMINATION BY ANY TAXING JURISDICTION.

THE APPROVED SUPPLEMENTAL COMPENSATION PLAN IS MADE IF THERE IS SUFFICIENT PROGRAM NET INCOME TO GENERATE THE SUPPLEMENTAL PAYMENT. THE POOL IS CAPPED AT 20% OF THE PRESIDENT'S SALARY AND UP TO 10% OF THE KEY STAFF SALARIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 WILL BE REVIEWED BY THE PRESIDENT, THE BOARD CHAIR, AND THE TREASURER, THEN MADE AVAILABLE FOR REVIEW BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. IT IS COMMUNICATED TO THE ENTIRE BODY WHEN IT IS COMPLETE AND MADE AVAILABLE FOR REVIEW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS SIGNED ANNUALLY BY BOARD MEMBERS. ADDITIONALLY, ANY NEW BUSINESS PRESENTED TO THE BOARD FOR APPROVAL IS PRECEDED BY COMMENTS AND DISCUSSION PERTAINING TO ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. IF ONE ARISES, THAT BOARD MEMBER ABSTAINS FROM VOTING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROCESS FOR COMPENSATION REVIEW INCLUDES SALARY SURVEY INFORMATION FROM LIKE AGENCIES AND REVIEW OF MATERIAL BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
THERE HAS BEEN NO CHANGE TO THE PROCESS OF SELECTION OF INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.
